article:
Significant people
* Charles I (the Bold) (1433â1477), Duke of Burgundy, r. 1467â1477
* Jean Fouquet of France (1420â1481), painter
* Francis II (1433â1488), Duke of Brittany, r. 1458â1488
* Gendun Drup of Tibet (1391â1474), First Dalai Lama
* Diogo Gomes of Portugal (1420â1485), navigator, explorer and writer
* Johannes Gutenberg of Mainz (1395?â1468), printer and inventor of the movable
  type printing press
* Henry the Navigator of Portugal (1394â1460), Portuguese prince and patron of
  exploration
* William Herbert of Wales (1423â1469), Pro-York nobleman
* Sir Thomas Malory of England (1405?â1471), soldier, member of Parliament,
  political prisoner, and author of Le Morte d'Arthur
* Richard Neville of England (1428â1471), nobleman, administrator, and
  military commander
* Demetrios Palaiologos of Morea (1407â1470), Byzantine Prince and
  Despot of Morea
* Thomas Palaiologos of Morea (1409â1465), Byzantine Prince and Despot of Morea
* Philip III (the Good) (1396â1467), Duke of Burgundy, r. 1419â1467
* Richard Plantagenet, Duke of Gloucester (1452â1483), English Prince, Yorkist
  commander, and future King of England
* Richard Plantagenet, 3rd Duke of York of England (1411-1460), nobleman,
  military commander, and Yorkist claimant to the Throne of England
* Mar Shimun IV, Patriarch of the Assyrian Church of the East (Patriarchate then
  based in Mosul), held position 1437â1497
* Tlacaelel (1397-1487), Tlacochcalcatl of the Aztec empire
* Jasper Tudor of Wales (c.1431â1495), nobleman and adventurer
* Owen Tudor of Wales (c.1400â1461), soldier and courtier at the court of the
  English Kings
* Andrea del Verrocchio of Florence (1435â1488), painter, sculptor, and
  goldsmith
